contentrichtext.text: '''Macaulay''' is a [[computer algebra system]] for doing [[polynomial]] computations, particularly [[GrÃ¶bner basis]] calculations. Macaulay is designed for solving problems in [[commutative algebra]] and [[algebraic geometry]]. It is named after [[Francis Sowerby Macaulay|F.S. Macaulay]], who worked in [[elimination theory]]. Macaulay was developed by [[Dave Bayer]] and Mike Stillman and was later completely rewritten by Dan Grayson and Mike Stillman as [[Macaulay2]]. ==See also== *[[Macaulay2]] *[[Comparison of computer algebra systems]] ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.math.columbia.edu/~bayer/Macaulay/}} {{Computer algebra systems}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Macaulay Computer Algebra System}} [[Category:Computer algebra systems]]
